materials.raw_text: Nb: 50 g, Sc: 80 g, Si: 160 g, W: 70 g

sourcing.instructions: Nb (Niobium) - Available from specialty metal suppliers or online metal marketplaces. Sc (Scandium) - Obtain from rare earth metal suppliers. Si (Silicon) - Can be sourced from electronics or semiconductor suppliers. W (Tungsten) - Available from industrial metal suppliers or online marketplaces.
steps: Nb (Niobium) - Available from specialty metal suppliers or online metal marketplaces. Sc (Scandium) - Obtain from rare earth metal suppliers. Si (Silicon) - Can be sourced from electronics or semiconductor suppliers. W (Tungsten) - Available from industrial metal suppliers or online marketplaces.

1. Measure out 50 g of Nb, 80 g of Sc, 160 g of Si, and 70 g of W with a precision scale. 2. Place Nb, Sc, Si, and W in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle or ball mill to thoroughly mix the powders until a uniform color and consistency is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a suitable mold (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches) ensuring an even distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 50 g of Nb, 80 g of Sc, 160 g of Si, and 70 g of W with a precision scale. 2. Place Nb, Sc, Si, and W in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle or ball mill to thoroughly mix the powders until a uniform color and consistency is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a suitable mold (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches) ensuring an even distribution.

steps: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1600 째C. 2. Once the desired temperature is reached, place the mold with the mixed powders into the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper melting and bonding of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1600 째C. 2. Once the desired temperature is reached, place the mold with the mixed powders into the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper melting and bonding of the materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25 째C). 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking or warping of the solid sample. This process may take 4-6 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25 째C). 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking or warping of the solid sample. This process may take 4-6 hours.

steps: 1. Carefully remove the solid sample from the mold after it has cooled completely. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges and surfaces. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating to enhance durability if the sample will be exposed to environmental factors.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Carefully remove the solid sample from the mold after it has cooled completely. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges and surfaces. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating to enhance durability if the sample will be exposed to environmental factors.
